Description: Shintech, Inc. and its subsidiary K-Bin, Inc., agreed to spend $4.8 million to comply with the Clean Air Act and the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act at their manufacturing facilities in Freeport, Texas.  The companies also agreed to pay a $2.585 million civil penalty to resolve environmental violations under the Clean Air Act, the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, and the Clean Water Act, and to perform $4.7 million worth of supplemental environmental projects.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
